To reasure the Business World stability And the British Nation
attributes.additional_details:
It is now important that the Goverment 
Stand and deliver on the democratic vote of this nation and come clean on there intentions No more dirty tricks lies and misleading information When will article 50 or Preferably article 72 be signed

attributes.action: A 5 year ban from public office for politicians who knowingly lie to the public.
attributes.background: The Brexit  debate has frustrated people on both sides. There have been many opinions put forward as facts but there have also been outright lies and some people believed them and are now annoyed. If a citizen said some of these things they would be sued but it seems OK if a politician says them.
attributes.additional_details: ¬£350 million pounds a week will be diverted from the EU to the NHS. 75 million Turks are on their way to Britain.

attributes.action: The independent election of the director general of the BBC.
attributes.background: There are numerous cases recently where the journalistic integrity and neutrality of the British Broadcasting Corporation has come into question.  The neutrality of the BBC is essential in order for the British people to make informed decisions regarding Politics in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Abolish chancel repair liability
attributes.background: Chancel repair liability is an outdated burden created when Henry VIII destroyed monasteries and gave away their land, rarely mentioned in  deeds to property, but by which some property owners have been asked to pay the cost of repairing the chancel of the church relevant to their property.
attributes.additional_details:
Claims for payment are usually based on old maps of former church property.  Church and diocese records which might relate to this matter are often incomplete or non-existent or have been destroyed because no one realised that they might have some significance.

Lord Avebury's Bill to abolish chancel repair liability in the House of Lords fell due to lack of time in the parliamentary session before the general election in 2015.  The property of many people is subject to chancel repair notices.

attributes.action: Create a free fast-track citizenship programme for current resident EU citizens
attributes.background: This petition calls on Parliament to create a fast-track citizenship programme at no cost for all non-native EU citizens who wish to remain in the UK following our exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Lift EU/US sanctions on Russia to increase trade now the UK is leaving the EU
attributes.background: As the UK has chosen to exit the EU, we will be no longer bound by US-influenced, EU sanctions on Russia. We should lift sanctions on Russia as an independent country to regain the millions of pounds of trade we have lost with Russia. We don't need to participate in EU/US sanctions against Russia.
attributes.additional_details: The EU and the US introduced sanctions on Russia over the democratic decision of the people of Crimea to reunify with Russia and Russia's alleged backing of separatists in Eastern Ukraine. The UK had to participate in this as an EU member. Now the UK is leaving the EU, we need not be dictated to by it. Lost trade with Russia costs the UK many millions of pounds. This is trade that we are now at liberty to get back. Russia is a market of 140m consumers British business needs.

attributes.action: UK must reaffirm its commitment of sovereignty over Gibraltar after Brexit
attributes.background: With Spain renewing its claim of sovereignty over Gibraltar in a matter hours after the UK voted to leave the European Union, the UK Government must immediately reaffirm its commitment to Gibraltar .
attributes.additional_details:
The UK must a make a binding treaty with the European Union guaranteeing Gibraltar special status, which guarantees visa free cross-border movement for people and trade between Gibraltar and Spain. 

The UK government must grant Gibraltar their own dedicated MP in parliament 

The UK must re-establish our permanent Army and Royal Navy bases on Gibraltar to guarantee its future security.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Jo Cox in Parliament Square.
attributes.background: Jo Cox was brutally murdered at her constituency surgery.  Jo was a well loved and respected campaigner and MP who always stood up for others.  Parliament Square has 11 statues, none of women.

attributes.action: Legalise the right to own and open/conceal carry a taser and/or pepper spray.
attributes.background: Through the years it has become more off a reality that the public is threatened. Police are no longer able to adequitley protect us. Tasers and pepper spray are non leathal and we should be allowed to carry them. As a human i have the right to protect myself and should be allowed to use these.
attributes.additional_details:
Rape is on the rise across the UK. Woman in particular are quite often not able to defend themselves and should be allowed to carry such defensive weapons as a taser or pepper spray. 

If a potential rapist, mugger etc saw a taser holstered to a persons hip they would be less inclined to carry out the crime. Same as if employees in shops had acess to one less robberies would take place. Common sense? Yes i think so.

attributes.action: Provide funds for Hospices &Charities(Herriot Hospice- Hambleton&Richmondshire)
attributes.background: Herriot Hospice are ceasing to provide end of life care.Funding has been cut and the charity has had to subsidise up to 60%.It has been able to do this due to legacy, but this has been spent.It has decided to cease the service from 1/08/16 as it is not prepared to compromise on the service.
attributes.additional_details: My mother was diagnosed with cancer in 2014. Her wish was that she could stay at home to die. Herriot Hospice end of life care made this possible. These services must be allowed to operate with funding. My family are humbled by the services the devoted people provided and how they looked after her. Please help try to promote and share this petition.

attributes.action: 23rd April to become Prince George of Cambridge‚Äôs Official birthday
attributes.background:
Currently our beloved Queen Elizabeth II has two birthdays, real and official.

I would like to propose the future King, Prince George of Cambridge (22nd July) also has an official birthday which would be the 23rd April, St George‚Äôs Day, thus giving the England a jolly good reason to celebrate!

attributes.action: Make legal Medical Cannabinoid Oil For personal use. Available to all patients
attributes.background: Documentated evidence  CB1 CB2 cannabinoids work  In regards to a test subject in Tenerife Certainly reporting positive feedback in regards to full relief from symptoms of Parkinson Disease
attributes.additional_details: Witness reports available from Kevin himself. His wife Susan. Myself the producer of the health oil.

attributes.action: Bring back Coursework for GCSE English language and Literature and Humanities.
attributes.background: I am someone that reaped the fruits of coursework and controlled assessments. It allowed me to learn how to produce academic literature, the kind one needs in the real world. The current changes to the GCSE represent a desire to return to a tried, tested and failed system based on rote learning.
attributes.additional_details: Coursework allows students an opportunity to express their voices and opinions in an education system that seems content in becoming pure indoctrination. It lets them showcase, articulate and evaluate all that they know and have learnt as well as applying this abstract knowledge to real issues. It's all well and good for children to learn of Shakespeare and his plays but not knowing how to properly formulate arguments which are logical and coherent will hinder them in the future.

attributes.action: Increase preschool and nursery funding entitlements.
attributes.background: Nurseries and Preschools are coming under increasing financial pressure due to the low amount paid by the government for the funded places for 2,3 and 4 year olds, coupled with increased costs due to rises in the National Living Wage and Pension rule changes.  A full review of the funding is needed.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount currently paid for a preschool funded place is far lower than the actual cost of providing the care, especially with other government changes meaning their costs have gone up significantly and will do again if the NLW rises as planned to ¬£9 per hour, and with the introduction of 30 hours free childcare places from 2017.

We would urge the government to carry out a full review of the amounts paid to ensure the continuation of our much needed preschools.

attributes.action: Decriminalise None Payment Of The BBC's Television Licence (TV Licence)
attributes.background: The BBC are backed by the UK Government to criminalise non payers of the TV licence. It currently costs ¬£145 a year for a colour licence. The people of the UK shouldn't be forced into paying a company that sort of money. Let's call on the government to decriminalise non payment of the TV licence!
attributes.additional_details: We are in the age of cuts, cuts & more cuts and the citizens of the UK simply do not have ¬£145 available. The BBC have already scrapped BBC THREE and now we are getting even less for our money. So help us help you by signing this petition to decriminalise nonpayment of the BBC's TV licence. ABOLISH THE TV LICENCE TAX!

attributes.action: MPs to have work experience, including a public service, prior to sitting.
attributes.background:
I feel in order to represent the general public as an MP it is important to have an understanding of various working backgrounds of their constituents.
Many Members of Parliament have little or no experience of 'ordinary work.'

attributes.action: Make tinted/mirrored motorbike visors legal
attributes.background: almost all bikers have the problem of having the sun in there eyes at one point or another this can be very dangerous if not lethal,not being able to see where you are going or any dangers that may appear could cause a accident or death.Such thing as tinted visors could make everyday safer.

attributes.action: Raising the minimum wage for 18 year olds.
attributes.background:
The government in their "master plan" to raise the minimum wage has not accounted for the many 18 year old's either not living at home for whatever reason or trying to contribute to a less well off family and have made it near impossible to make a liveable wage 
the current rate is ¬£5.30 per hour

attributes.action: Scrap Income Tax for pensioners on limited income, who have to pay care costs.
attributes.background: My father has an income of c¬£12000 pa from pensions he paid into from age 14. He is now a 95 year old, disabled war veteran who pays¬£16350 for care 3 x a day, so he can stay in his own home. In addition he has running costs for his house,constant central heating set at 21 degrees, council tax, food.
attributes.additional_details: I understand from Internet posts, people in residential care are liable to income tax and in this area it costs ¬£1350 per week to live in a good care home (no such thing as an excellent care home) and it is ¬£950 per week for a bad care home! When I spoke to a person from DWP, she confirmed there is no tax exemption. Dad like many of his generation has savings, because he worked from age 14, did not smoke or drink, no holidays abroad and did not spend on his house which is now in disrepair.

attributes.action: Introduce a standard low rate VAT on Gym Memberships.
attributes.background:
Unlike other businesses that can claim back VAT from business expenses gyms have very few expenses to claim back.
Gyms give a life line for the community educating the public how to live healthy lives a valid reason to consider a lower rate this will help the government health budget and save money

attributes.action: Have schools teach children the signs of domestic abuse, physical & emotional.
attributes.background: There are too many people who are being abused in their home and we need to make people including young children who may be victims of it aware of the signs so they can go for help if they need to. It will help reduce the amount of deaths each year which go unnoticed.
attributes.additional_details: There are many helpline such as Rising Sun but we need to make sure children and even adults are aware of this as well as aware of the tell tale signs that someone is a victim of abuse, or that they may be a victim.

attributes.action: Raise university tuition fees using current CPI, not forecasted RPIX
attributes.background: This petition urges the government to use CPI (currently at 0.5%) to increase tuition fees instead of the 2.8% forecasted rate from the Office of Budget Responsibility. This rate will benefit students more, whilst also covering the cost of inflation for universities.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the HE Bill universities are already publishing new tuition fees of ¬£9250 per year, an increase of just under 2.8%. Currently, no rate of inflation published by ONS is close to 2.8% and RPIX, the rate the government is making calculations on, is only 1.5%. 2.8% is a 10 year forecast for RPIX. To put tutition fees in line with inflation a new tuition fee should be calculated each year using CPI figures at the time.

attributes.action: Stop organisations from charging more for not making payment by Direct Debit.
attributes.background: Direct debit gives a third party open access to your wallet and bank account at any time and at will. Those who pay by other LEGAL methods are penalized with higher fees. In effect its a stealth tax charged by companies who want easy access to YOUR money. Its not right, Its not moral and its unjust.
attributes.additional_details:
If funds are not available or a payments going into account are not there on time due to bank errors or delays in employee payments or benefit payments it can cause LIFE THREATENING problems for those on a low budget as bank fees are taken from allowances put aside for food or essentials. This puts incredible pressure those on a tight budget who are hit the most with unrealistic fees for returned direct debits forcing them into further debt.

This is immoral for modern day British Companies.

attributes.action: Restore the small profits rate of Corporation Tax at 15% for profits to ¬£300,000
attributes.background:
Since the 2011-12 tax year, the small profits rate of Corporation Tax has been eroded to zero.

In these uncertain economic times, we ask the government to support small businesses by restoring the small profits rate of Corporation Tax at 15% and locking this rate at 5% lower than the main rate.
attributes.additional_details:
In the 2011-12 tax year, the main rate of Corporation Tax was 26% against the small profits rate of 20% for businesses with profits of up to ¬£300,000.

Since then, the main rate has been steadily reduced with no comparable reduction in the small profits rate.  

As a result, since April 2015, there has been a harmonized Corporation Tax rate of 20%.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to determine what alternative to EU membership the UK wants.
attributes.background: After being given the choice of remaining or leaving the EU in the recent referendum, it is only proper that the people of the UK should have the right to choose what type of relationship they want with the EU so that the government has better guidance in its negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
The main alternatives to membership in the EU are set out in the Cabinet Office's policy paper "Alternatives to membership: possible models for the United Kingdom outside the European Union, dated 2 March 2016.  Remaining in the EU should be one of the choices in case people do not like the alternatives.  The choices should be:

1) Be a member of the European Economic Area
2) Negotiate a bilateral agreement with the EU
3) Be a member of the World Trade Organisation
4) Remain a member of the EU

attributes.action: Hold a UK referendum on the future of the union between Scotland and England.
attributes.background: Now the result of the EU referendum is known, the Scottish Government considers the prospect of a second Scottish independence referendum 'on the table'. A National referendum would allow for the will of the entire electorate to be known on the future of the Union formed in 1707.
attributes.additional_details: Some are calling, as in 2014, for the rest of the UK to have a voice in the question of Scottish independance. Many Scots, resident elsewhere in the UK or even Expats who were eligible to vote in the EU referendum, were not eligible for the 2014 independence referendum.

attributes.action: Introduce a new written UK Constitution
attributes.background: In the wake of the UK's imminent exit from the EU, we need a written Constitution at this time of uncertainty to shape the relationship between the citizens and the state. We need a written Constitution that reflects the values of a modern society that is tolerant, pluralistic and multicultural.
attributes.additional_details: The immediate legal consequences of leaving the EU are far-reaching and uncertain for fundamental rights of UK citizens. We need a set of ground rules that we understand and which respect our fundamental rights and freedoms in matters of employment law, property, housing, healthcare, education, children and access to courts. The drafting of a new UK Constitution should not be delayed.

attributes.action: We are calling on the Govt to strip Thameslink Govia of their rail franchise.
attributes.background: Govia Thameslink has the highest number of passenger journeys but the lowest customer satisfaction rates and the lowest PPM of any UK rail network. There has been a continuous decline in their PPM measure since 2015. They have the second highest rate of cancellation & significantly late running.
attributes.additional_details:
Thameslink Govia's poor management is evident in:
The lack of adequate contingency plans to cope with disruption.
Poor & inaccurate information provided to customers 
The ongoing staffing disputes without major disruption to the network. 
Continually increasing fares with declining service levels

We urge the government to urgently review the situation and award the franchise to a company which can deliver a consistent, good level of service.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for people to smoke while in charge of a motor vehicle.
attributes.background: Using a mobile phone behind the wheel in the UK is banned because it's distracting and causes accidents, so why isn't smoking behind the wheel illegal too. It's dangerous for drivers as only one hand is likely to be present, but also distracting to roll, find and light a cigarette.
attributes.additional_details: Attention is key while driving and smoking distracts you fully from the road. It should not be allowed to promote safety in cars and also healthier living in the population.

attributes.action: Ban all chocolate made by child labour from entering the UK.
attributes.background: Thousands of children from different parts of the world are captured and sold into slavery to work on cocoa plantation farms for the use of large chocolate companies. Sign this petition to help these children gain back their rights and freedom.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently over 27 million slaves world-wide and 9 million of these are children sold into various trades. 

We want to help tackle this issue by first tackling the chocolate trade by banning chocolate that is cultivated by children from entering the UK. This ban would raise world-wide awareness on an issue, which is currently being ignored.

attributes.action: Give ALL Uni Students EQUAL opportunity for same amount of living grant (loan)
attributes.background: Currently a Student loan for living costs is given on the basis of household income - so if you have 2 average earning Parents that live together the Student can get ¬£3800 per Yr this DOES NOT even cover their rent in halls - if those Parents separated the Student can get ¬£8000 loan per Yr WRONG!!

attributes.action: change the law so a child cant leave home at 16years old
attributes.background: because it is a parents responsibility to make sure a child stops in full time education until they are 18years old.
attributes.additional_details: if your child doesn't come home one Sunday night and you know where they are but you haven't given your permission for your child to stay out the police cant help you get your child home, so you can make sure your child attends school

attributes.action: Ban horse racing to stop anymore deaths
attributes.background: Five horses have died too are selfish needs how many more?
attributes.additional_details: As people know five horses has died üêéüêéüêéüêéüêé how many more? It needs too stop it's not right! It's not fair! I don't have a problem with betting but what I do have a problem with is gambling on lives theses horses have lives and hearts and are constantly put under strain all for a selfish human ways please please help it stop

attributes.action: Get rid of the extra 3 per cent stamp duty bill
attributes.background: From April 1 2016, anyone purchasing an additional property will have to pay an extra 3 per cent stamp duty.  The changes apply to companies and individuals no matter how many properties you are purchasing.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone owning a second property that isn't their main residence and buying another, or replacing the one they don't live in, is likely to get caught up in the changes. So even if you are applying for a joint mortgage to enable someone to get on the property ladder as a first time buyer you have to pay the stamp duty making it impossible for first time buyers.

attributes.action: Footcare to be free of charge to residents in care homes maintaining mobility.
attributes.background: Care home residents are unable to care for their own feet due to mobility and/or mental impairments. They have to cover care costs, and are left with very limited personal funds. Neglected foot health can lead to other health problems and limitations of mobility this care should be provided.

attributes.action: Force Mr.Cameron to stick to his promises to increase spending on mental health
attributes.background: Mental illness is an illness like any other. Yet cuts to resources are continuously being made, and those who need help, cannot always find it, living a life of seclusion and loneliness. You can see a broken arm or leg, but you cannot see a broken mind, often leading to despair.
attributes.additional_details: It is estimated 1 in 4 people in Britain suffer from, or have suffered from some form of Mental illness. There is a lot of Stigma attached to this distressing condition, many do not seek help because of the risk of verbal or physical abuse, and live a life of seclusion, often resulting in suicide. Those who seek help, cannot find it as there is nowhere to go, GP's are not trained in this field, and cannot make a diagnosis or know what to prescribe. Mental Health resources must be increased.

attributes.action: Make conjugal visits legal in the UK
attributes.background: Conjucal visits in the uk could help inmates As there wouldn't be so much tension In the prison, it would relieve frustration which would make it a calmer environment. Also give the inmates something to work towards. Also partners on the outside suffer being away from there loved ones.

attributes.action: Stop Scottish MPs voting against bills for England that are enacted in Scotland
attributes.background: SNP voting against the Sunday Trading Hours Bill for England and Wales was wrong and selfish, as Scotland has more lax trading hours on Sundays so it is unfair that Scottish MPs vote against something to be enacted in England that is already enacted in Scotland.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage to ¬£10/hr and ban 0hr contracts.
attributes.background: We the undersigned hereby demand that the national minimum wage is to be raised to ¬£10/hr and continue to raise it in line with inflation. Additionally we also demand that the government ban zero hour contracts.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of basic foods such as eggs, milk, bread, flour etc. has nearly tripled in the last 10 years. (+%300) The NMW however has only incrased a fraction compared to that. This move would not only improve the quality of life for britain's poorest working families but also take many people of benefits and even encourage more people to work thereby freeing up money to be spent elsewhere. This petition is also aimed to stop employers exploiting 0hr contracts.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory standards for how MPs communicate with their constituents.
attributes.background: Once an MP is elected, they can ignore their Constituents‚Äô wishes.  Constituents must wait five years before they can do anything about this.  MPs can even ignore Disabled Constituents, or refuse to have email addresses etc. for people to contact them.
attributes.additional_details:
MPs should be required to:-
1)  make contacting them accessible for everyone; and
2)  adhere to basic equality standards.

attributes.action: Record biometric data for all migrants and refugees entering the United Kingdom
attributes.background: To protect UK citizens from criminal or terrorist acts by refugees and migrants and to protect those refugees and migrants from exploitation and harm. Obtaining biometric data will remove anonymity, allowing the welfare of migrants to be monitored and providing a deterrent to crime and terrorism.

attributes.action: Review family courts and cafcass mode of operation and predjudicial views.
attributes.background: A request that a Parliamentary commitee be set up to review the way family courts are conducted, the basis of evidence that they and cafcass depend on to make decisions, and the way family courts and CAFCASS are biased towards the mothers wishes over the fathers, more importantly the childs needs.
attributes.additional_details:
It is widely viewed amongst society that fathers are heavily penalised in child contact cases, and that all support is heavily biased towards mothers. 

Many fathers are wrongfully accused and a scan of mothers forums show evidence of collaboration in what accusations to make to prevent/limit contact. CAFCASS are complicit in these activities and their case workers highly prejudiced. Mothers are not held accountable for falsifying accusations.

attributes.action: Replace religious education in UK schools with a comparative history of religion
attributes.background: Religion can be the cause of social and educational schism.
attributes.additional_details: School is our first experience of institutional life and so, as a priority, it should be inclusive and harmonised from the outset. Religion is used in our schools as a context to teach ethics. A Comparative History of Religion will foster objectivity and tolerance, which are themselves virtuous. A Comparative History of Religion will produce an empirical lesson in social harmony that is psychologically wholesome, undeniable and therefore enduring.

attributes.action: Treat male and female victims of domestic and sexual violence equally.
attributes.background: The UK government sees domestic and sexual abuse as a gender issue. ¬£50 million + is spent funding services for female victims. Nothing is spent on male victims.1/3 of all victims are male. 1 in 6 men experience abuse. The government needs a minister for men and boys, there is a minister for women.
attributes.additional_details: Research suggests 1 in 6 men experience some form of abuse. 30 men each year are killed. No government funding is provided to any service for male victims of domestic abuse, some money is given to the men's advice line. There are approx 10 000 refuge beds specifically for women, there are around 20 for men. 2 out of every 5 victims are male 40% men need 40% of the budget allocated to services to fund refuge beds, outreach support etc. This is not a gender issue this is about victims not gender.

attributes.action: To require a two-thirds majority vote for all referendums in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
A referendum on a national level is meant to be a means for parliament to secure popular consent on issues that leave government divided, or when there is special need for a vote of public support.

This cannot be done when important constitutional changes are decided with a 1-5% majority.
attributes.additional_details:
With turnout in referendums generally falling, the UK needs to adapt it's rules according to voting so that two-thirds majority is required. The UK needs to factor in the fact that turnout will never be 100%, and that 51% of anything less than that is not an actual majority.

A two-thirds majority vote would secure popular consent on every level referendums are held, ensuring that government would have a genuine majority to grant the decision legitimacy regardless of voter turnout.

attributes.action: Raise awareness for Seat Back Failure, putting your children's lives at risk.
attributes.background: During a rear impact crash our front seats fully reclined with force, we have been informed this is standard from 'cheap' cars- ours was a 2014 model.  This happens with all makes and models potentially putting passenger's lives at risk. This Is unacceptable and higher standards are needed.
attributes.additional_details: Our mechanic informed us it is expected from cheaper cars as they use low quality seats, more expensive makes use higher quality. We believe there should be a standard of seats used, we are told to put our children in the back of our cars- unbeknownst to us potentially putting their lives at risk should they be in a crash! The front seats fly back at force, along with the person in them and the passengers in the back are flung forward- it's so very very dangerous.

attributes.action: All NHS trusts should provide dual diagnosis treatment
attributes.background:
When mental health problems and substance misuse co-exist, this is known as a dual diagnosis. 22-44% of all adult inpatients in England also have a substance misuse problem and 22% of all suicides are linked to alcohol use.

Why are so many people falling through the net?
attributes.additional_details:
Many NHS trusts simply refuse to make a mental health diagnosis if the individual is under the influence of alcohol.  Without an assessment, an appropriate referral cannot be made and treatment cannot be given, leaving the individual to continue self-medicating while their physical and mental health deteriorates. 

Sectioning or suicide shouldn't be the only options left. 

Early intervention is vital. More funding is needed. More training. More communication. More person-centred treatment.

attributes.action: Replace BSL (breed specific law) with blanket legislation applying to all dogs.
attributes.background:
BSL permits unfair treatment of certain dog breeds based on stereotypes. This should be replaced with a blanket legislation applying to all dogs regardless of breed.

The current legislation also falsely suggests that all dogs not of specific breeds must be friendly, which is not always the case.

attributes.action: Reduce Animal testing and put harsher rules in place when testing on animals
attributes.background: I have never been a fan of animal testing but I believe without it we wouldn't have the scientific knowledge that we have now. I would like the government to put harsher rules on animal testing and also for companies to have to display that they test on animals on the labels of their products.
attributes.additional_details:
A little more information... Some of the rules that I believe should be put in place:

-Any animal that is tested on should immediately be released and   
given the best quality of life possible or be put down. They should also be given freedom while being tested on.
-Any company that tests on animals should be forced to make a 
minimum donation to charities that support any animal wellbeing. 
-Any company or brand that tests on animals must display this on their packaging in the UK.

attributes.action: Guns and knives are to injure or kill, fixed 15 year sentence for possession!
attributes.background: Gun & Knife crime is drastically rising. All that are from an area where this is relevant know full well it is because the youth today have no fear or comprehension of consequences. This needs to change! Knowing you will serve 15 years with no half serving, no good behaviour is the place to start.
attributes.additional_details:
With the restrictions put on parenting, the amount of power children & teenagers are allowed to have on how they are educated, raised and dealt with, have all led to a carefree, lack of respect attitude with no understanding of cause & effect. Introducing a fixed/minimum sentencing of 15 years for possession of a gun/knife/weapon to injure or kill would really make a difference.

I know full well that me and anyone I grew up with who carried would never have done so had this been the case.
